title: Mourning Sampler, 1803
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery, paint and ink on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered in stem, satin, knot stitches andcouching on plain weave foundation using chenille and loosely twisted threads, with painted background
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Donor's notes state: "Bought through the Reverend Dean Philemon Sturges at Princeton, Mass."
description:
An oval scene of a woman leaning on a tomb; a child with a basket of flowers is seated in front. The inscription on the tomb reads: 
In Memory of
Mr. John Nye
Obiit (sic) Oct 17 1803
Aetatis 28 

There is a large weeping willow on the left and a distant landscape of water and a town beyond. Only the trees, grass and shrubbery are embroidered; the rest is painted.

tombstone.epitaph:
Mourning Sampler, 1803.Medium: silk embroidery, paint and ink on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered in stem, satin, knot stitches andcouching on plain weave foundation using chenille and loosely twisted threads, with painted background. 1984-100-5.
